intro: Echinospermum redowskii var. affine, commonly known as the redowskii echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are arranged in a cluster, typical of the family. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapting to arid environments. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
